text.__SUMMARY__: The Far Eastern myotis or bombinus bat, (Myotis bombinus), is a species of mouse-eared bat found in East Asia.  It is widespread but uncommon across the Korean Peninsula, and spends the winter hibernating in caves.
text.References: Won, Changman; Kimberly G. Smith (1999). "History and current status of mammals of the Korean Peninsula". Mammal Review. 29 (1): 3–33. doi:10.1046/j.1365-2907.1999.00034.x.
